results.user_msg: Find recent arXiv papers about "federated learning" and give a short 2-sentence summary.
results.expected_text: Recent federated learning research focuses on handling non-IID data and improving robustness and security (including defenses against adversarial and backdoor attacks), while also exploring decentralized and asynchronous training methods and server-free architectures. Additional work addresses interpretability, heterogeneous client environments, and extensions toward privacy-preserving or quantum federated optimizations.
results.actual_text:
Summary:
This collection of documents explores advancements and challenges in federated learning, a privacy-preserving machine learning approach. Document 1 surveys security aspects of combining federated and transfer learning, while Document 2 introduces VAFL, an asynchronous vertical federated learning method that enhances privacy and communication efficiency. Document 3 proposes a central server-free federated learning algorithm, OPS, designed for scenarios without a central authority and with unidirectional trust relationships, like social networks.

Here are the papers with links:
1. Federated and Transfer Learning: A Survey on Adversaries and Defense Mechanisms — https://arxiv.org/abs/2207.02337v1
2. VAFL: a Method of Vertical Asynchronous Federated Learning — https://arxiv.org/abs/2007.06081v1
3. Central Server Free Federated Learning over Single-sided Trust Social Networks — https://arxiv.org/abs/1910.04956v2
results.compare_text:

Document 3 proposes a central server-free federated learning algorithm, OPS, designed for scenarios without a central authority and with unidirectional trust relationships, like social networks.

Here are the papers with links:
